alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Delaware; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 10:29PM CDT until April 04 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Buchanan County in northeastern Iowa... Benton County in east central Iowa... Northwestern Delaware County in northeastern Iowa... Northwestern Linn County in east central Iowa... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1028 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jesup to near Rodgers Park to near Elberon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Jesup and Mount Auburn around 1035 PM CDT. Minne Estema Park, Independence Airport and Littleton around 1040 PM CDT. Independence, Brandon, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Buchanan County Fairgrounds and Otterville around 1045 PM CDT. Lime Creek County Park and Fontana County Park around 1050 PM CDT. Vinton and Benton County Fairgrounds around 1055 PM CDT. Rowley, Hoefle-Dulin Park and Vinton Memorial Airport around 1100 PM CDT. Jakway Park and Benton City Park around 1105 PM CDT. Quasqueton, Lamont, Aurora, Cheney and Wildcat Bluff Park around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Lime Creek County Park, Winthrop Golf Course, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Vinton Memorial Airport, Rodgers Park, Benton City Park, Fontana County Park, Pleasant Creek State Recreation Area, Littleton and Hoefle-Dulin Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
